pr_title: Implemented Frame Size Negotiation in ALTS for gRPC Java

timeline.bodyText:
Currently max_frame_size is defined in AltsTsiFrameProtector.java.
Please define min/max in AltsTsiFrameProtector.java.
timeline.author: jiangtaoli2016

replies.bodyText:
In AltsTsiFrameProtector.java, we could have 4 constants
MIN_FRAME_SIZE, 16KB
MAX_FRAME_SIZE, 128KB
DEFAULT_FRAME_SIZE, 16KB
LIMIT_MAX_ALLOWED_FRAME_SIZE, 1MB
We may need to change internal code to sync up.
replies.author: jiangtaoli2016

replies.bodyText:
Do we need both MIN_FRAME_SIZE and DEFAULT_FRAME_SIZE?
I think for consistency sake, MIN_FRAME_SIZE name would be preferred. But that would involve updating MAX_ALLOWED_FRAME_BYTES to MIN_FRAME_SIZE, and wherever the getter is called. If the variable name modification seems fine, we could have just 3 constants.
replies.author: ashithasantosh

replies.bodyText:
3 constants are fine.
We need 4 getter functions to be backward compatible.
replies.author: jiangtaoli2016

replies.bodyText:
I am using just 3 getters.
For Loas2TsiHandshaker.java, i will cherrypick this CL, and include the update there.
replies.author: ashithasantosh

timeline.bodyText:
As in my other comment above, don't set maxFrameSize here.
If there is no frame size negotiation, use the value from parameter -- which will be the default frame size
timeline.author: jiangtaoli2016

timeline.message: Implemented Frame Size Negotiation in ALTS for gRPC Java.
